skill.name: woocommerce-dev-cycle
skill.description: Run tests, linting, and quality checks for WooCommerce development. Use when running tests, fixing code style, or following the development workflow.
skill.summary: Run tests, linting, and quality checks for WooCommerce development. Use when running tests, fixing c...
skill.author: woocommerce

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown documentation files that provide guidance for running tests and linting commands. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or external commands are present. The skill is purely informational and poses no security risk.

content.value_statement: WooCommerce developers need to run tests and linting to ensure code quality. This skill provides the exact commands and workflows for PHP unit tests, JavaScript tests, and code style checks in the WooCommerce monorepo.
actual_capabilities: Run PHP unit tests with PHPUnit via Docker environment
Run JavaScript and Jest tests for the admin client
Check and fix PHP code style with WordPress Coding Standards
Lint JavaScript and TypeScript files for code quality
Fix markdown files with markdownlint for documentation
Troubleshoot common test and linting failures
limitations: Does not execute tests or linting automatically
Requires Docker and wp-env for PHP test environment
Commands are for the WooCommerce monorepo only
Does not configure or install dependencies

use_cases.title: Run test suite
use_cases.description: Run PHP and JavaScript tests to verify code changes before committing

use_cases.title: Check code quality
use_cases.description: Run linting commands to verify code follows WordPress coding standards

use_cases.title: Lint documentation
use_cases.description: Check markdown files pass markdownlint validation before creating PRs

prompt_templates.title: Run PHP tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the PHP tests for the PaymentsExtensionSuggestionsTest class using the WooCommerce dev cycle skill

prompt_templates.title: Fix linting issues
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me fix PHP linting issues in my changed files using the WooCommerce dev cycle skill

prompt_templates.title: Check JS linting
prompt_templates.prompt: Run JavaScript linting on the files I changed in my current branch

prompt_templates.title: Full workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me through the full WooCommerce development cycle: run tests, check linting, and fix any issues

output_examples.input: Run PHP unit tests for the SettingsPaymentsTest class
output: 1. Run test: pnpm run test:php:env -- --filter SettingsPaymentsTest
3. To stop on first failure: add --stop-on-failure flag
4. Test environment handles WordPress and WooCommerce setup automatically

best_practices: Run specific tests for changed code during development to save time
Always run linting before committing to catch style issues early
Use --stop-on-failure during active development to focus on one issue
Review automatic fixes with git diff before committing
anti_patterns: Running linting on the entire codebase instead of only changed files
Skipping linting checks before committing code changes
Ignoring test failures without investigating the root cause
Using absolute paths for markdownlint which bypasses config

faq.question: What PHP version is used for tests?
faq.answer: Tests run in Docker with PHP 8.1 and PHPUnit 9.6.24 via wp-env.

faq.question: How do I run tests for a single method?
faq.answer: Use the filter syntax: pnpm run test:php:env -- --filter ClassName::methodName

faq.question: Can I integrate this with CI pipelines?
faq.answer: Commands work in CI. Use full test runs without --filter for CI environments.

faq.question: Is my data safe when running these commands?
faq.answer: Commands run locally in Docker. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why do I get class not found errors?
faq.answer: Run pnpm install to install dependencies. Restart wp-env if issues persist.

faq.question: How is this different from other PHP linting skills?
faq.answer: This skill is specific to WooCommerce monorepo with WordPress coding standards configured.
